modules.description: This module implements low-level communication with Ledger hardware wallets using HID devices or proxy paths. It provides functions to open and close connections, send and receive APDU commands, and handle transport-level errors with precise status reporting. Use cases include interacting with Ledger devices for cryptocurrency operations like signing transactions or retrieving wallet data.

This module implements low-level communication with Ledger hardware wallets over HIDAPI. It provides functions to send APDU commands, read responses with status codes, and send ping packets, all handling binary data through `Cstruct.t` buffers. These operations are used to interact directly with Ledger devices for cryptocurrency operations like signing transactions or retrieving wallet information.

This module constructs and serializes APDU commands for communication with hardware wallets. It supports creating APDU packets with custom class, instruction, parameters, and data payloads, enforcing size limits. Use it to send structured binary commands over USB or Bluetooth to devices like Ledger wallets.

This module defines a set of error and status codes returned by Ledger wallet operations, including specific conditions like invalid PIN, incorrect data length, and security violations. It provides functions to convert status codes to strings, format them for display, and register custom string or help message handlers. These operations are used to interpret and report device responses during cryptographic operations or firmware interactions.

This module implements a transport layer for communicating with a Ledger wallet device using APDU commands. It provides functions to create and close a connection, send APDU packets, and read responses including status codes and payloads. It handles errors during communication and supports concrete workflows like querying device status or signing transactions.

This module provides operations for constructing APDU commands, interpreting device status codes, and managing communication with hardware wallets using HID or proxy transports. It works with binary data structures like `Cstruct.t` to handle APDU packets, error codes, and device responses during cryptographic operations. Concrete use cases include signing cryptocurrency transactions, authenticating with a device, and retrieving wallet metadata over USB or Bluetooth.
